intro: Torilis arvensis subsp. turcomanica, commonly known as the Turkestan hedge parsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in steppe and grassland habitats. Its leaves are finely divided and have a peppery scent, while its flowers are white to pale yellow. It is an annual or biennial herb that plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
